intro: Oryctanthus scabridus, commonly known as the rough oryx flower, is a South African plant belonging to the Aizoaceae family. It is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and produces bright yellow or orange flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, with a deep root system to access water. It thrives in rocky soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Oryctanthus scabridus is popular in rock gardens due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
